intro: Borreria argentea, commonly known as silver borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in open woodlands or along roadsides. Borreria argentea is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
